The Act extends various authorities related to healthcare and services for veterans until September 30, 2014 and October 1, 2014. This includes copayments for hospital and nursing home care, recovery from third parties for non-service-connected disability care, and homeless veterans reintegration programs. Extensions of Authorities Affecting Homeless Veterans include amending programs for homeless veterans reintegration and referral services for veterans at risk of homelessness transitioning from institutions. The extension of previously fully-funded authorities for homeless veterans is also addressed. The funding for comprehensive service programs for homeless veterans is increased to $250,000,000 for fiscal year 2014 and $150,000,000 for fiscal year 2015 and beyond. Amendments are made to provide financial assistance for supportive services and extend grant programs for homeless veterans with special needs. The grant program for homeless veterans with special needs is extended through 2014. Additionally, there is an extension of temporary eligibility for specially adapted housing assistance for veterans with disabilities causing difficulty with ambulating until September 30, 2014. The Secretary's authority is amended to limit approval of assistance applications for disabled veterans in fiscal year 2014. Extension of authority to calculate net value of real property securing defaulted loans is also amended. Additionally, the pilot program on assistance for child care for certain veterans receiving health care is extended to a 3-year period, ending in 2014. The Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010 is amended to extend certain provisions to 2014. The use of the National Directory of New Hires for income verification purposes for certain veterans benefits is reauthorized.
